com.turn.shapeshifter

Class NamedSchema

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.turn.shapeshifter.NamedSchema
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Schema

    public class NamedSchema
extends Object
implements Schema
    A configurable, immutable schema with a name.

    This implementation of Schema is highly configurable and provides features and settings that allow the translation between Protocol Buffers and JSON to be customized at will. Here is the most basic example of usage: 

     MyProto proto = MyProto.newBuilder().setFoo("bar").build();
 Schema.of(MyProto.getDescriptor()).getSerializer().serialize(proto);

    This will return a JsonNode which looks like:

     { "foo": "bar" }

    By default, this implementation implements the following bahavior:

    • All fields are considered during serialization and parsing phases.
    • Fields that are not explicitly set, empty repeated fields and objects in which no fields are set are ignored.
    • Fields names are converted between lower_undesrcore and lowerCamel.
    • Proto enums values are serialized as strings, formatted as lowerCamel.

    NamedSchemas are configurable to customize the external JSON representation of a given message:

    • addConstant(String, String) adds a constant field to the output.
    • skip(String...) lets you hide fields defined in the protocol buffer from the outside world.
    • substitute(String, String) lets you change the name of a protocol buffer field to something more appropriate
    • enumCaseFormat(CaseFormat) allows for changing the case format used for serializing and parsing enums.
    • transform(String, Transformer) provides full control over how the value of a field is parsed or serialized.
    • mapRepeatedField(String, String) lets you implement dynamic JSON objects, where a property's key will be taken from a given field of a repeated object.
    • useSchema(String, String) lets you specify a schema for fields that reference other Protocol Buffer message types.

    Warning: Schema instances are always immutable. Configuration methods such as skip(String...) or substitute(String, String) always return a new instance and have no effect on the instance they are invoked on. This makes Schemas thread-safe and ideal to be stored as static final constants:

     Schema schema = Schema.of(MyProto.getDescriptorForType());
 schema.skip("foo"); // don't do this
 schema.getSerializer().serialize(proto); // will include 'foo'
    Author:
    jsilland

      • substitute

        public NamedSchema substitute(String fieldName,
                     String substitution)
        Returns a schema that will substitute a given field name in the serialized JSON.

        The substituted name remains subject to the configured case formatting.

        Parameters:
        fieldName - the name of the field to substitute
        substitution - the string to use for the substitution

        Parameters:
        fieldName - the name of the field to transform
        transformer - the transformation to apply

      • mapRepeatedField

        public NamedSchema mapRepeatedField(String fieldName,
                           String keyFieldName)
        Returns a new schema that will serialize repeated objects as a JSON object instead of a JSON array.

        This transformation is useful in cases where the source object contains a list of objects identified by a given field. Normally, such a list would be serialized as:

        "users": [
		{"username": "lrichie", name: "Lionel Richie"},
		{"username": "stwain", "name": "Shania Twain"}
 ]

        A common JSON idiom is to represent such collections as pseudo-maps, i.e.objects with non-predefined keys:

        "users": {
	"lrichie": {"name": "Lionel Richie"},
	"stwain": {"name": "Shania Twain"}
 }

        To achieve this effect, call this method with "users" and "username" as parameters, respectively.

        Parameters:
        fieldName - Must point to a repeated object field in this schema
        keyFieldName - Must be a string field in the repeated field

      • describe

        public NamedSchema describe(String fieldName,
                   String description)
        Returns a new schema in which fieldName will be documented.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the name of the field to document
        description - the documentation of the field

      • useSchema

        public NamedSchema useSchema(String fieldName,
                    String schemaName)
        Returns a new schema in which the given field will be delegated to the specified schema.

        The field must be a submessage and its type must match that of schema.

        Parameters:
        fieldName - the name of the field, which must be of object type
        schemaName - the name of the schema to delegate this field to

      • setFormat

        public NamedSchema setFormat(String fieldName,
                    String format)
        Returns a new schema in which the given field with have a format attribute.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the name of the field to specify a format for
        format - the format of the property
